title: Kurt-Wabbel-Stadion
text:
The Kurt-Wabbel-Stadion was a <a href="multi-purpose%20stadium">multi-purpose stadium</a> in <a href="Halle%2C%20Saxony-Anhalt">Halle (Saale)</a>, <a href="Germany">Germany</a>. It was used mostly for <a href="Association%20football">football</a> matches and was the home of <a href="Hallescher%20FC">Hallescher FC</a> until . It had a capacity of 23,860.
The stadium was opened in 1936 and was originally named after <a href="Sturmabteilung">SA</a> officer <a href="Horst%20Wessel">Horst Wessel</a>, before it was renamed the Kurt-Wabbel-Stadion, in honour of <a href="Kurt%20Wabbel">Kurt Wabbel</a> following the end of World War Two. The stadium was used by <a href="Turbine%20Halle">Turbine Halle</a> and <a href="Hallescher%20FC">Chemie Halle</a>, who later changed their name to Hallescher FC.
It was closed in 2010 and replaced by <a href="Erdgas%20Sportpark">Erdgas Sportpark</a>.
